description: Dark chocolate and hazelnut make the perfect pairing. And now, this deliciously inspired combo can be yours in minutes with a few easy steps.
name: Nutty Dark Chocolate Cold Brew
recipeIngredient: 6 oz Starbucks® Dark Chocolate Hazelnut Cold Brew Concentrate
2 oz almondmilk (or your choice of milk)

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 01
recipeInstructions.text: In a large glass, stir together 6 oz of Starbucks® Dark Chocolate Hazelnut Cold Brew Concentrate 6 oz of water, and 1-2 oz Vanilla Syrup.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 02
recipeInstructions.text: Add enough ice to fill the glass to ½ inch below the rim, leaving room for milk.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 03
recipeInstructions.text: Top with your desired amount of almondmilk.

description: Turn any day into a special occasion. This Vanilla Iced Coffee with Cake Batter Foam packs all the delicious nostalgia of your favorite cake into each easy glass.
name: Vanilla Iced Coffee With Cake Batter Foam
recipeIngredient: 6 oz  Starbucks® Iced Coffee Blend coffee, brewed according to instructions
0.25 tsp cake batter flavored extract (or ½ tsp butter flavored extract and ½ tsp almond extract)*​

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 01
recipeInstructions.text: Fill a 16-oz tumbler (glass not recommended) with ice, about ¾ of the way.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 02
recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Vanilla Iced Coffee Blend K-Cup® Pod (as directed) into the tumbler using the 6-oz iced setting on the brewer. Use the strong or iced button if available. Or, if using Starbucks® Iced Coffee Blend Ground Coffee, brew 3 Tbsp coffee grounds per 6 oz of water in your brewer of choice. Pour coffee into the tumbler.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 03
recipeInstructions.text: Using any cold frothing method, froth together Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Creamer, milk and desired flavored extracts.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 04
recipeInstructions.text: Add as much or as little foam as you desire to the top of your drink.​

description: Sweet. Creamy. And chilled to perfection. Rich espresso, milk and vanilla syrup are topped with caramel for a delightfully refreshing start to your day.
name: Iced Caramel Macchiato
recipeIngredient: homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought) for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Place vanilla syrup in a glass.
Add cold 2% milk.
Fill glass with ice to ½ inch below rim.
Pour in Starbucks® espresso shots.
Top with caramel sauce.

description: Our Iced Latte recipe turns your favorite morning beverage into a refreshing drink that you can enjoy at any time of the day. All you need is some ice, a splash of milk and rich espresso-like coffee from a stovetop brewer. Grab your mason jar to add some cold foam for an elevated twist, or customize your coffee with a little vanilla for a classic Iced Vanilla Latte.
name: Iced Latte
recipeIngredient: Optional sweetener of choice, such as homemade Vanilla Syrup (or storebought)

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a tall glass with ice, and pour in the freshly brewed espresso.
Pour the milk and optional sweetener into a mason jar until it’s ¾ full.
Seal the jar tightly, and shake, shake, shake.
Pour the milk and foam into the glass with the ice and espresso.

description: Warm days are made for cold foam. Start your morning with an icy sweet treat.
name: Vanilla Sweet Cream Cold Foam

recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Breakfast Blend at double strength and pour over ice.
Combine milk, powdered sugar and vanilla extract​ in separate pourable container.
Froth milk mixture using your preferred cold method. You can use a handheld milk frother or froth your milk by hand. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Top iced coffee with cold foam.

description: Shake up your coffee routine with a cup of creamy oatmilk, rich espresso and perfectly sweet brown sugar.
name: Iced Brown Sugar Oatmilk Shaken Espresso​
recipeIngredient: 2 shots espresso brewed from Starbucks® Veranda Blend® whole bean ​coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare espresso and pour into a glass.
Stir light brown sugar into the espresso while still hot to dissolve. Refine to your desired level of sweetness.
In a cocktail shaker or mason jar, add espresso, oatmilk and ice and shake for 20 seconds.
Pour into tall glass and top with a dash of cinnamon.

description: Soft and balanced shots of Starbucks® Blonde Espresso Roast by Nespresso®. Shaken over ice with vanilla syrup. Topped with maple cold foam and a pinch of spice. A Vanilla-Maple Shaken Espresso is layered with incredible flavor.
name: Vanilla-Maple Shaken Espresso
recipeIngredient: 3 shots Starbucks® Blonde Espresso Roast by Nespresso®
Pinch of pumpkin pie spice (or cinnamon and nutmeg)

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 01
recipeInstructions.text: Brew espresso shots.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 02
recipeInstructions.text: Fill a tall glass 3/4 full of ice.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 03
recipeInstructions.text: Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add espresso shots and vanilla syrup.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 04
recipeInstructions.text: Shake vigorously until the exterior of the cocktail shaker is cold. Strain into glass.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 05
recipeInstructions.text: Froth oatmilk and maple syrup until desired texture is reached.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 06
recipeInstructions.text: Top shaken espresso with maple cold foam and a pinch of pumpkin pie spice.

description: Elevate your everyday glass of cold brew with sweet and spiced oatmilk ice and the incredible taste of new Starbucks® Brown Sugar Cinnamon Cold Brew Concentrate.
name: Brown Sugar Cinnamon Cold Brew With Oatmilk Ice
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Brown Sugar Cinnamon Flavored Cold Brew Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Make the oatmilk ice cubes. In a measuring cup with a spout, combine oatmilk, brown sugar and cinnamon. Stir until sugar dissolves.
Pour oatmilk mixture into ice cube trays. Freeze until solid—usually 3–4 hours.
Prepare cold brew by combining concentrate and water. Chill.
Fill glass with oatmilk ice to a half-inch below the rim.
Fill glass with chilled cold brew to a half-inch below the rim.
Top with oatmilk to taste.

description: Let's mix up one of the greats. Our cold brew concentrate makes it easy to enjoy the café-inspired Vanilla Sweet Cream Cold Brew you know and love from the comfort of home.
name: Vanilla Sweet Cream Cold Brew
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Signature Black Cold Brew Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Place ingredients in a jar that seals tight. Shake well to combine the ingredients.
Measure vanilla syrup into a 16 oz glass.
Add Starbucks® Signature Black Cold Brew Concentrate and water to the glass. Stir to combine.
Fill the glass with ice to a half inch below the rim.
Fill the cup to the rim with vanilla sweet cream.

description: Rich caramel and sweet peach flavor in every sip. Create this refreshing and juicy recipe featuring Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Coffee, brewed to perfection with Nespresso® Vertuo.
name: Caramel Coffee Peach Spritzer​
recipeIngredient: 3 oz Caramel Coffee Vanilla Syrup (recipe below)​
Peach slices or turbinado sugar as garnish (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Place sugar in a 16-oz container and then brew 1 capsule of Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Coffee for Nespresso® Vertuo on top.
Let cool and add the vanilla extract. ​
Start by placing ice into a 16-oz glass.
Add in the Caramel Coffee Vanilla Syrup, followed by the peach nectar. ​
Fill glass to the top with chilled soda water and enjoy.

description: Enjoy caramel coffee at its creamiest and coldest. This easy café-inspired recipe has everything you love, just in time for summer.
name: Creamy Salted Caramel Cold Brew
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Caramel Dolce Flavored Cold Brew Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Place vanilla syrup into a 16 oz glass.
Add Starbucks® Caramel Dolce Flavored Cold Brew Concentrate and water to the glass. Stir to combine.
Fill the cup with ice to a half inch below the rim.
Using a frother on its cold setting or a frothing wand, froth Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Creamer and pinch of salt.
Fill the glass to the rim with the frothy creamer.

description: Enhance the cinnamon, butter and brown sugar notes of Starbucks® Cinnamon Dolce Flavored Coffee with this iced au lait inspired by the beloved Starbucks® Iced Cinnamon Dolce Latte at our cafés. ​
name: Iced Cinnamon Dolce Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 6 oz brewed Starbucks® Cinnamon Dolce Flavored Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a small container and store.
Combine brewed coffee with whole milk and Cinnamon Dolce Syrup in a glass. Stir together.
Fill with ice.
Top with prepared whipped cream.
Sprinkle with Cinnamon Dolce Topping.

description: This new recipe for Nespresso® Original Line is a celebration of the iconic flavor of caramel. Refreshing and topped with a sweet caramel cold foam, it’s perfect for easy sipping on a peaceful day.
name: Iced Triple-Caramel Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 2  brewed espresso shots of Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Coffee by Nespresso®

recipeInstructions.text: Using a milk frother on its cold setting or a frothing wand, froth milk, caramel sauce and sea salt until smooth and creamy with fine bubbles. Set aside.
Pour caramel sauce into a 16-oz glass.
Brew 2 shots of Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Coffee by Nespresso® directly into the glass. Stir.
Fill glass with ice to 1 inch below the rim. Stir.
Top with Salted Caramel Cold Foam.

description: Chocolate syrup, cinnamon syrup and creamy oatmilk cold foam come together with Starbucks® Cinnamon Dolce Naturally Flavored Coffee for a drink that’s equal parts rich and refreshing. Take a moment for yourself and chill out with an Iced Cinnamon Dolce Mocha with Cinnamon Oatmilk Cold Foam. ​
name: Iced Cinnamon Dolce Mocha With Cinnamon Oatmilk Cold Foam
recipeIngredient: 8 oz Starbucks® Cinnamon Dolce Naturally Flavored Coffee, brewed and cooled
2 Tbsp homemade Cinnamon Dolce Syrup (or storebought)
Ground cinnamon, cinnamon stick, cocoa, or chocolate shavings for garnish (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Pour chocolate syrup into a 16-oz glass.​
Add cooled Starbucks® Cinnamon Dolce to the glass. Stir.​
Fill the cup with ice to ½ inch below the rim.​

Froth oatmilk and cinnamon syrup using your preferred cold method. You can use a handheld frother or froth the oatmilk by hand. For more information on how to froth milk or milk alternatives, see our frothing guide here.
Fill the glass to the rim with the cinnamon oatmilk cold foam.
Garnish with a sprinkle of cocoa or ground cinnamon, a cinnamon stick or chocolate shavings.

description: Add a springtime spin to your coffee routine with a delicious layering of blueberry flavor and an iced cup of Starbucks® Spring Day Blend.
name: Blueberry Swirl Iced Coffee
recipeIngredient: 8 oz Starbucks® Spring Day Blend, brewed and cooled

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the blueberries, honey and vanilla in a small saucepan.​
Heat over medium-high heat for 3–4 minutes, until blueberries have broken down. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Blend blueberry mixture in a high-speed or immersion blender until smooth.​
Brew your coffee and allow it to cool. ​
Pour the blueberry compote in a 16 oz glass, sprinkle with desired amount of sugar and top with ice.​
Froth milk to create cold foam using an aerator or handheld frother. ​
Gently pour the cold foam into glass on top of the blueberry compote. ​
Fill your glass with cooled Starbucks® Spring Day Blend​. Enjoy. ​

description: Just in time for your spring happy hours. Craft a cocktail that will wow with the sweet and nutty flavor of Starbucks® Toasted Coconut Mocha Flavored Coffee and richness of Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Creamer.
name: Coconut Caramel Cream Cocktail​
recipeIngredient: 3 oz Starbucks® Toasted Coconut Mocha Flavored Coffee, brewed and cooled
0.5 tsp homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought), plus more to taste
homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought) for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Brew your coffee and allow to cool.
Place ice into a blender, then add cooled Starbucks® Toasted Coconut Mocha Flavored Coffee, rum, almond liqueur, Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Creamer, Caramel Sauce and cinnamon. Blend until smooth.​
Drizzle a line of Caramel Sauce along the inside of your glass.
Pour blended cocktail into glass and enjoy.

description: Spring gatherings just got more delicious. Grab a bag of Starbucks® Spring Day Blend coffee to craft a crisp, refreshing mocktail at home.
name: Iced Coffee Sparkling Mojito Mocktail
recipeIngredient: 3 sprigs fresh mint (with stems removed and leaves intact)​
4 oz ground Starbucks® Spring Day Blend coffee, brewed and cooled​

recipeInstructions.text: Add sugar, a lime wedge and two sprigs of mint to a tall Collins glass. Muddle.
Add ice to the muddled ingredients. Pour the cooled coffee and top with club soda. Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a lime wedge and mint sprig to enjoy.

description: The delicious smoothness of Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee serves as the base for an incredibly refreshing spritzer. Bold, citrusy and nicely spiced—it’s the ideal mocktail for easy sipping.
name: Citrus Coffee Spritzer
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Veranda Blend® Cinnamon Citrus Syrup (recipe below)

recipeInstructions.text: Place cinnamon stick and sugar in a heat resistant container.
Brew 8 oz of Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee into the container and stir.
Place orange peel strips into the liquid.
Remove orange peel and cinnamon stick.
Place ice into a 16-oz glass.
Add Starbucks® Veranda Blend® Cinnamon Citrus Syrup.
Fill glass to top with chilled soda water.
Top with orange twist.

description: When life gives you a lemon twist, add a vanilla coffee spritz. Try this citrusy and bubbly drink with Starbucks® Spring Day Blend coffee to brighten your spring coffee routine.
name: Vanilla Coffee Spritzer with a Lemon Twist
recipeIngredient: 3 oz Coffee Vanilla Simple Syrup (recipe below)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar and brewed Starbucks® Spring Day Blend coffee in a heatproof bowl. Stir.​
Once sugar is dissolved, allow to cool and add vanilla extract.
Store in a container in refrigerator until ready to use.
Slice and juice the lemon.
Fill a tall Collins glass with crushed ice, Coffee Vanilla Syrup and lemon juice. Top with soda water and stir to combine. Garnish with lemon zest and enjoy.​

description: Perk up your senses with this rich and refreshing iced coffee drink. Our Iced Hazelnut Coffee recipe is easy to make. Try it with Pike Place® Roast or any of your favorite Starbucks® coffees, then mix and top with milk for a delicious and cool drink that offers a sweet take on iced coffee.
name: Iced Hazelnut Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Add ice and Hazelnut Syrup to a tall glass.
Brew Pike Place® Roast, then add to glass.
Top with milk.
Stir until Hazelnut Syrup is combined.

description: Ready to shake things up? Craft rich notes of caramelized vanilla in this café-inspired shaken iced coffee recipe featuring Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Coffee.​
name: Iced Toasted Vanilla Shaken Coffee with Oatmilk
recipeIngredient: 6 oz Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Coffee (K-Cup® pod or ground coffee)

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the vanilla bean.
Caramelize sugar in skillet with vanilla. Then remove from heat and cool for up to 5 minutes.​
Add water to the cooled skilled. Turn heat back on and gently boil until caramelized sugar dissolves and combines with the water.
Store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
Prepare 6 oz of Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Coffee and pour into a cocktail shaker or Mason jar.
Stir 2 oz of Toasted Vanilla Syrup into the coffee and add ½ cup of ice. Shake for 20 seconds.
Strain into a tall glass with fresh ice. Add oatmilk and enjoy.

description: Inspired by the café favorite Starbucks® Frappuccino®, our Caramel Frozen Blended Coffee recipe is where coffee, milk and ice all come together for a delicious and icy drink.
name: Caramel Frozen Blended Coffee
recipeIngredient: 1 packet Starbucks VIA® Instant Italian Roast
2 Tbsp homemade Caramel Syrup (or storebought), plus more for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Blend your Starbucks VIA® Instant Italian Roast coffee in a blender along with your milk, caramel syrup, salt and ice. Mix on high until smooth.
Once blended, pour the mixture into your glass and top your drink off with a swirl of whipped cream and an additional drizzle of caramel sauce for the full café experience.

description: Add some fun flair and great flavor to your glass of iced coffee with caramel stripes in this easy-to-make recipe.
name: Brown Sugar Cinnamon Iced Coffee With Caramel Stripes
recipeIngredient: 8 oz brewed Starbucks® Brown Sugar Cinnamon Naturally Flavored Coffee or 1 K-Cup® Pod

recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Brown Sugar Cinnamon Flavored Coffee at double strength.  Place brewed coffee and a glass in the refrigerator to chill.
Pour caramel sauce into chilled glass. ​
Make the caramel stripes.
Fill the glass with ice to a half-inch below the rim.​
Add chilled coffee and top with Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Creamer. Stir gently. ​

description: Condensed milk is a popular ingredient in coffee drinks around the world, from the sweet, creamy Vietnamese iced coffee (cà phê sữa dá) to Spain’s rich coffee drink (café bombón), where a layer of condensed milk is poured beneath a fresh pull of espresso. This cinnamon-infused version of the café favorite is simple to make—just shake it up and pour for a refreshing iced coffee that’s equal parts spicy and sweet.
name: Iced Cinnamon Coffee
recipeIngredient: 5 oz  double-strength coffee (try Starbucks® Breakfast Blend)

recipeInstructions.text: Stir coffee, condensed milk and ground cinnamon together in a cocktail shaker.
Add ice.
Cover and shake vigorously for 2 minutes.
Strain into a glass filled with ice.

description: Drizzle all the way! Embrace the season with this deliciously fun caramel spiced iced coffee featuring Starbucks® Gingerbread Naturally Flavored Coffee and Caramel Flavored Creamer.
name: Iced Gingerbread Caramel Coffee
recipeIngredient: 6 oz double-strength Starbucks® Gingerbread Naturally Flavored Coffee, (double strength with 4 Tbsp)​

recipeInstructions.text: Place ice into 16-oz glass.
Brew Starbucks® Gingerbread Naturally Flavored Coffee at double strength and pour into glass.
Add Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Creamer​. Stir.
Top with whipped cream, a drizzle of Caramel Sauce and a pinch of nutmeg. Enjoy!

description: Brighten your brew with lemonade and a splash of sparkling water. It may seem an unlikely combination, but adding lemonade to your homemade iced coffee creates a bold, tangy and delicious drink. Think of it as an Arnold Palmer, with strong coffee instead of black tea.
name: Iced Coffee Lemonade
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup lemonade (either ready-made or use our recipe below)

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, combine sugar and water. Stir over medium heat for 5 minutes until sugar has dissolved into a simple syrup.
Remove from heat and let cool completely.
Juice lemons.
Stir together remaining water, simple syrup and lemon juice.
Fill a glass with ice.
Prepare double-strength coffee in your preferred method. For optimal taste, we recommend using the coffee press method.
Mix together lemonade and coffee, leaving room to customize to taste. We recommend 1 part coffee to 1 part lemonade.
Add a splash of sparkling water.

description: This caramel-infused Iced Latte is topped with a drizzle of rich vanilla cream and is as simple to make as it is delicious. Here’s how to balance the flavors perfectly for a sweet way to cool off with a refreshing caramel coffee.
name: Iced Caramel Latte with Vanilla Cream
recipeIngredient: 2 oz espresso or coffee from a stovetop brewer (try Starbucks® Espresso Roast)

recipeInstructions.text: Add heavy whipping cream, vanilla and granulated sugar to a medium-sized bowl.
Using a hand mixer or whisk, beat until it achieves a thick and creamy consistency. Be careful not to overmix, or you’ll end up with whipped cream.
Add caramel sauce, brown sugar and brewed espresso to a large glass.
Mix together until combined, then add ice.
Slowly top off with the vanilla cream.

description: Espresso, shaken, not stirred. Grab your fanciest martini glass and get shaking on our Espresso Martini recipe, a delicious way to enjoy your favorite espresso flavor and unwind with a rich cocktail at the same time.
name: Espresso Martini

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 1 shot of Starbucks® Espresso Roast coffee and let cool before prepping the cocktail.
Place the vodka, coffee liqueur and espresso in a cocktail shaker with ice.​
Shake vigorously 10 times, then strain briskly into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with 3 coffee beans and serve immediately.​

description: Starbucks® Premium Instant, our new instant coffee, is made with 100% arabica beans. That means you can enjoy the delicious Starbucks® coffee taste you love in an instant. In addition to the convenience of having Starbucks® coffee ready at a moment’s notice, Starbucks® Premium Instant Coffee is a versatile coffee that can be enjoyed many different ways. Try our Iced Premium Instant Coffee recipe—a delicious way to stir up a refreshing beverage in an instant.
name: Iced Premium Instant Coffee
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp Starbucks® Premium Instant Medium Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Scoop instant coffee into your favorite mug.
Add cool or room temperature water.
Grab a spoon and stir until the microgrounds have dissolved.
Add ice.

description: Enjoy this chilled version of the café favorite Pumpkin Spice Latte. Simply combine an easy-to-make glass of cold brew with homemade syrup and a delicious pumpkin spice whipped cream for the perfect blend of fall flavors.
name: Pumpkin Whipped Cream Cold Brew​
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Signature Black Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar and water in saucepan and bring to a simmer.
Once sugar is dissolved, add cinnamon sticks, ground cloves, ginger, nutmeg and pumpkin purée, and let simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and immediately strain through cheesecloth.
Get a jump-start on the whipped cream by placing a whisk and large mixing bowl in freezer to chill, at least 15 minutes.
Pour Starbucks® Cold Brew Signature Black Concentrate into a glass over ice, add water and stir.
Stir Vanilla Syrup into cold brew.

In chilled mixing bowl, vigorously whisk heavy whipping cream, sugar and Homemade Pumpkin Spice Syrup to desired thickness (2 to 5 minutes). Layer Pumpkin Whipped Cream over the top of cold brew to taste.
Personalize with a sprinkle of ground nutmeg!

description: Coconutmilk and espresso are paired over a bed of ice in this cold, classic coffee drink that’s sweet, refreshing and delicious. Enjoy this delectable dairy-free latte anytime you’re in the mood for a fruit-flavored pick-me-up.
name: Iced Coconutmilk Latte
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® by Nespresso® Espresso Roast capsule or

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 1 shot of espresso. Let cool.
Pour your coconutmilk and your espresso shot over ice and stir.

description: The Mocha Frozen Blended Coffee, where coffee, milk, ice and chocolaty goodness all come together for a delicious cold drink. Inspired by the café favorite Starbucks® Frappuccino® Blended Beverage, this recipe is perfect whenever you're in need of a sweet pick-me-up. Top it off with whipped cream and chocolate shavings for a sweet ending that’s deliciously Starbucks.
name: Mocha Frozen Blended Coffee​

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 1 shot of espresso.
Place ice, milk, chocolate sauce and espresso into a blender. Start at low speed, then blend on high for 30 seconds.
Pour blended mixture into 16-oz glass.
Top with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

description: In this refreshing twist on cold brew, the sweetness of homemade honey syrup combines with a pinch of savory salt for a uniquely delicious coffee that still feels distinctly Starbucks.
name: Cold Brew With Salted Honey Foam
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup skim milk (or milk of choice)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine honey and water in a small pot on the stove over medium heat until lightly simmering.
Let simmer for 5–7 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat, and let cool for 20–30 minutes.
Add skim milk, Honey Syrup and a pinch of salt to a milk frother.
Using the frother’s cold froth setting, froth the mixture for 2 minutes until thick and creamy.
Pour 4 oz of Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate into a glass over ice, combine with 4 oz of water and stir.
Stir in the remaining Honey Syrup.
Pour or spoon the salted cream cold foam over top!

description: Grab your Starbucks VIA® Instant and whip up a delicious Dalgona that’s as customizable as it is photogenic. Hailing from Korea and popular online, this coffee is easy and fun to make.
name: Starbucks® Dalgona Whipped Coffee
recipeIngredient: 1 packets Starbucks VIA® Instant Pike Place® Roast

recipeInstructions.text: In a mixing bowl, combine your Starbucks VIA® Instant coffee, sugar and water.
Whisk together vigorously until the mixture turns light and fluffy.
Continue whisking until your mixture thickens and holds a foamy texture.
Fill your glass most of the way up with ice and the milk of your choice.
Dollop and swirl the whipped coffee mixture on top.

description: Cold brew has become the go-to drink when you need a quick pick-me-up, and it’s easy to see why. Equal parts refreshing, energizing and customizable, cold brew is a drink that can satisfy any coffee fan with ease. With Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrates, available in both single-serve and multi-serve formats, it’s easier than ever to enjoy the cold brew taste you love at home. We’ll show you three different ways to dress up your cold brew so your cup is always exciting and always delicious.
name: Cold Brew 3 Ways

recipeInstructions.name: WHAT YOU’LL NEED
recipeInstructions.text: 8 oz Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate or 1 pod Starbucks® Single-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate4 oz sparkling water4 oz homemade lemonade (recipe below) or store-bought lemonadeLemon slice, for garnish

recipeInstructions.name: FOR LEMONADE
recipeInstructions.text: ¼ cup white sugar2 cups still water, separated2 oz fresh-squeezed lemon juice

Begin by making homemade lemonade. In a small pot, combine sugar and ¼ cup of water. Stir over medium heat until sugar has dissolved into simple syrup. After 5 minutes remove from heat and let cool completely.
In a pitcher or large jar, add remaining water, the simple syrup and lemon juice. Stir to combine. Store lemonade in an airtight container, refrigerated for up to 7 days.

For each serving, pour 8 oz of Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate into a glass over ice, combine with 4 oz of sparkling water and stir. If using Starbucks® Single-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate, pour 1 pod into a glass over ice, combine with 8 oz of water and stir.
Pour 4 oz of lemonade in the glass of cold brew. Garnish with a lemon slice.

recipeInstructions.name: HOW TO MAKE
recipeInstructions.text: Grapefruit Basil Cold Brew

recipeInstructions.name: WHAT YOU’LL NEED
recipeInstructions.text: ½ Tbsp Grapefruit Basil Simple Syrup (recipe below)2 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate2 oz tonic waterIce

recipeInstructions.name: FOR GRAPEFRUIT BASIL SYRUP
recipeInstructions.text: 1 oz water1 oz grapefruit juice¼ cup sugar¼ cup fresh basil leavesZest of 1 small grapefruitGrapefruit slices, for garnishFresh basil, for garnish
Begin by combining all grapefruit basil syrup ingredients in a small saucepan. Slowly bring to a boil, stirring until sugar has dissolved.
Strain the syrup into an airtight container. If making ahead, you can keep the syrup refrigerated for up to 1 month.
Combine Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate, 1 Tbsp Grapefruit Basil Simple Syrup and tonic water over ice and stir.
Garnish with a slice of grapefruit and basil!

recipeInstructions.name: HOW TO MAKE
recipeInstructions.text: Cherry Cold Brew

recipeInstructions.name: WHAT YOU’LL NEED
recipeInstructions.text: 4 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate2 Tbsp maraschino cherry juiceIce4 oz tonic waterMaraschino cherries, for garnish
Stir together Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate, maraschino cherry juice and ice.
Top with tonic water and garnish with a maraschino cherry.

description: Cold brew tonics are making a fizzy splash. They’re like the sophisticated, modern version of the old-fashioned soda fountain drink. But instead of the egg cream’s milk and chocolate syrup, this cold brew tonic recipe features smooth, bold coffee and orange cardamom simple syrup. Learn how to make this recipe using Starbucks® Cold Brew Coffee Multi-Serve Concentrates.
name: Cold Brew Orange Tonic
recipeIngredient: Starbucks® Cold Brew Coffee Multi-Serve Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Pour 4 oz of Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate into a glass over ice, combine with 4 oz of water and stir.
Make the orange cardamom simple syrup by combining water, juice, sugar, cardamom and orange zest in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil to dissolve sugar, then let cool.
Strain out cardamom and orange zest.
Fill a tall glass with ice.
Pour in simple syrup, then add cold brew and tonic water.
Stir and garnish with an orange slice.

description: Cold brew is the go-to cold coffee drink for many people, and it’s easy to see why. Equal parts delicious and refreshing, cold brew is the perfect drink to grab any time you need a cool pick-me-up. Enjoy this bubbly, citrusy twist on cold brew.
name: Sparkling Cold Brew
recipeIngredient: Starbucks® Signature Black Cold Brew Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Pour 4 oz Starbucks® Signature Black Cold Brew Concentrate over ice.
Top with sparkling water.
Add an orange or lemon twist!

description: Learn how to make a delicious Vietnamese Iced Coffee with Starbucks® coffee. Take your taste buds on a trip with this refreshing recipe featuring iced coffee and swirling condensed milk. Recipe and image sourced from Tastemade & Starbucks recipe book partnership.
name: Vietnamese Iced Coffee
recipeIngredient: 4 oz brewed Starbucks® Caffè Verona® Ground Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Brew your Starbucks® Caffè Verona® ground coffee. For optimal taste, we recommend using the pour-over method.
Pour your brewed coffee over ice and leave some room at the top.
Pour your sweetened condensed milk into the top of the glass.
Stir and top your drink off with a mint sprig.

description: Enjoy a Coffee Peanut Butter Protein Smoothie with Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast to give you the flavor you need for your busy day. Packed with banana, peanut butter, chia seeds and honey, this rich coffee smoothie recipe is a perfectly delicious way to start the day.
name: Coffee Peanut Butter Smoothie
recipeIngredient: 6 oz Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Add Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast coffee, banana, chocolate almondmilk, chia seeds, honey and peanut butter to the blender.
Blend until smooth.
Add ice cubes to make smoothie thicker if you prefer. Blend again.

description: Coffee, banana and frozen yogurt: an irresistible breakfast trifecta. Here’s how to combine them in a smoothie that is sure to become a delicious new part of your morning routine.
name: Coffee Smoothie
recipeIngredient: 1 packet Starbucks VIA® Instant French Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Add frozen yogurt, milk, Starbucks VIA® Instant Coffee, banana and ice to a blender.
Blend the ingredients until the mixture is smooth.

description: Start the day with a rich and refreshing iced coffee that bears hints of cinnamon and honey with each sip.
name: Iced Cinnamon Honey Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, bring your water, honey and cinnamon sticks to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and let simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla and let cool completely.
Store your syrup in a container in the fridge.
Add ice cubes to a glass.
Prepare double-strength coffee in your preferred method. For optimal taste, we recommend using the coffee press method.
Pour in coffee, milk and your cinnamon honey syrup, then stir to combine.
Adjust to your taste with milk and syrup.

description: Longer days, warmer nights and a taste for all things iced. This easy-to-make recipe for Starbucks® Iced Coffee Cocktails combines our two favorite things: Breakfast Blend and a splash of flavored spirits.
name: Iced Coffee Cocktails

recipeInstructions.text: Brew your coffee in a pour-over or coffee press.
Mix together coffee and vodka, stirring as you pour.
Add the remaining ingredients to taste, then pour over ice.

description: This creative take on the classic cocktail is easy to make and sure to delight. In place of the bourbon traditionally used to make an Old Fashioned, we’re substituting delicious homemade cold brew coffee.
name: Cold Brew Old Fashioned

recipeInstructions.text: Drape cheesecloth inside the mason jar.
Add coffee. We recommend Starbucks® Breakfast Blend with a coarse grind. Fill with pure, filtered water. Steep for 12 hours at room temperature.
Strain and discard cheesecloth with coffee grounds.
Make orange syrup. Add water, raw sugar and orange peels to saucepan.
Make orange syrup. Add water, raw sugar and orange peels to saucepan.
Add orange syrup and Angostura® bitters to glass and stir.
Add ice then top with the Breakfast Blend cold brew that you steeped overnight.
Rim glass with orange peel.
Garnish with an orange twist and a cherry or two.

description: Grab a cocktail shaker and shake it up! This classic Italian iced espresso recipe is a delicious, sweet, creamy drink that’s topped off with a fluffly layer of foam.
name: Shakerato
recipeIngredient: 4 oz brewed Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast ground coffee, chilled (we recommend using the traditional drip method)

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium saucepan, add sweetened condensed milk and half and half (or whole milk). Over low heat, stir frequently for 5–10 minutes.
Cool completely and keep refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days.
Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add chilled co­ffee and simple syrup.
Shake vigorously for 20–30 seconds until coffee becomes foamy. Strain into a glass. Top with coffee foam from shaker.
Add sweet cream syrup to taste.

description: Cold brew … coconut … milkshake … need we say more? This delicious, refreshing and tasty beverage is a frosty way to indulge, cool down and perk up all at the same time! Recipe and image sourced from Tastemade & Starbucks recipe book partnership.
name: Cold Brew Coconut Chocolate Milkshake
recipeIngredient: 4 oz  Starbucks® Cold Brew Multi-Serve Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Combine your Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate, coconut ice cream and semisweet chocolate chips in blender, then blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and top with whipped cream and toasted coconut.

description: It’s Dalgona with a twist. Try our cold brew take on the viral coffee sensation, and learn how to make it upside down for a drink that’s as delicious as it is eye-catching.
name: Upside Down Cold Brew Dalgona Coffee
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate Signature Black

recipeInstructions.text: Pour 4 oz of Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate into a glass over ice, combine with 4 oz of water and stir.
In a mixing bowl, combine your heavy cream, sugar and vanilla and whisk vigorously until the mixture turns light and fluffy like whipped cream.
Layer your whipped topping over the top of the coffee.
Make your drink a little more summery with unique toppings like coconut shavings, fruit or cinnamon.

description: Rich, creamy and dairy-free. Delicious coconut, Starbucks® Sumatra coffee and a hint of cocoa make this smoothie an irresistible treat.
name: Blended Coconut Coffee
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup  light coconutmilk, canned (shake well before opening)
0.5 cup  strong brewed coffee (try Starbucks® Sumatra)

recipeInstructions.text: Add ice, brown sugar, cocoa powder, coconutmilk and coffee to blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and serve.

description: Our Iced Irish Coffee recipe turns the iconic combination of coffee, Irish cream liqueur and whiskey into a delicious iced beverage.
name: Iced Irish Coffee​
recipeIngredient: 7 Tbsp  Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast coffee (brewed at double strength)

recipeInstructions.text: Pour double-strength coffee, whiskey and Irish cream liqueur over ice and stir.
Add mint sprig for garnish.

description: Some people might tell you that sangria is a drink best enjoyed in the warm weather of the summer. Well, we think something this delicious shouldn’t be saved for just one season. Learn how to make a delicious sangria with Starbucks VIA® Instant and enjoy these fruity flavors whenever you feel that inner warm weather feeling calling. While this recipe is nonalcoholic, you can also add your favorite fruit-forward or full-bodied wine as a nice pairing to spice things up.
name: Sangria with Starbucks VIA® Instant
recipeIngredient: 0.0625 cup sugar, plus extra for garnish
0.25 orange, sliced into ¼-inch wheels, plus zest

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar, juices and fruit in a pitcher. Stir to dissolve sugar.
Let chill for several hours.
Dissolve Starbucks VIA® Colombia with a tablespoon of hot water in a large glass. Add a cup of the juice mixture and stir to fully combine.
Add back into sangria pitcher and stir to combine.
Right before serving, add soda water to sangria pitcher.
Take zest from orange and combine with equal amount of sugar. Dip moistened rims of tall glasses into the mixture.
Serve your sparkling creation and don’t forget to make sure everyone has a little bit of fruit in their glass, that’s the best part!

description: Enjoy a cold brew with sugar, spice and everything nice. This recipe takes the cold brew you already know and love from Starbucks® and infuses it with aromatic orange and a hint of cinnamon.
name: Spiced Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate​

recipeInstructions.text: Start by adding coffee, sugar, cinnamon sticks and orange peel to coffee press. Mix well.
Add water, then let sit for 18–24 hours in the refrigerator.
Press the coffee, pour it into a clean jar and seal.
When ready, pour equal parts concentrate and water into a glass.

description: A glitzy holiday deserves a classy cocktail. Ring in the new year in style with this smoky-sweet French Roast cocktail with a hint of bright citrus.
name: NYE Iced Coffee Cocktail

recipeInstructions.text: Brew 4 oz of Starbucks® French Roast coffee using your preferred brewing method.
Chill the coffee in the fridge.
In a shaker, combine the bourbon whiskey, crème de cacao, simple syrup, orange bitters and coffee.
Add ice into the shaker and shake 10 times to chill the beverage.
Strain the beverage into a glass over fresh ice.

description: Refreshing, decadent and ready in a matter of minutes. It's easier than ever to make a classic iced mocha at home with Starbucks® Premium Instant Coffee.
name: Iced Mocha
recipeIngredient: 4 oz whole milk or any non-dairy alternative
Whipped cream and chocolate syrup or shavings (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine Starbucks® Premium Instant Coffee and cool water in a glass.
Fill with ice.
Combine whole milk and chocolate syrup in a separate glass. Stir together then combine with the first glass.
Top with whipped cream and chocolate syrup or shavings to taste, and enjoy.

description: Looking for a delicious way to cool off on a warm day? Try this fresh take on a traditional ice cream float. Easy to make at home, this cold brew coffee drink is ready to delight anyone who loves the combination of sweet and salty.
name: Smoked Sea Salt Coffee Float

recipeInstructions.text: Cover a large mason jar with cheesecloth.
Add coffee.
Fill with the gallon of pure, filtered water.
Steep for 12 hours at room temperature.
Make the Smoked Sea Salt and Vanilla Syrup by combining 1 cup water, raw sugar, vanilla and smoked sea salt in saucepan (detailed steps below).
Bring to a boil to dissolve sugar, then let cool.
Strain cold brew and discard cheesecloth with grounds.
For the coffee float, mix Smoked Sea Salt Syrup and cold brew in glass.
Add vanilla gelato or ice cream.
Top with a splash of sparkling water.
Garnish with smoked sea salt.
Split the vanilla bean* lengthwise, scrape the seeds using the edge of a knife, then add both the bean and seeds to a saucepan.
Add in all other ingredients over medium heat and cook until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to a boil.
Remove from heat and cool completely.
Pour into a glass jar and store at room temperature.

description: Starbucks® Colombia medium roast coffee mixed with cookies and cream ice cream? Yes, please! This spin on a classic Italian dessert is easy to make and impossible to forget.
name: Affogato Dessert​
recipeIngredient: 1 scoop  cookies and cream ice cream

recipeInstructions.text: Brew and pour espresso shot over scoop of ice cream.
Top with candy, nuts or whipped cream (optional).

description: Minty meets iced coffee for an incredibly refreshing experience. Simply combine a packet of Starbucks VIA® Instant with lemonade, cucumber and mint for a drink that’s packed with fresh-tasting flavor.
name: Starbucks® Iced Mint Coffee
recipeIngredient: 1 packet  Starbucks VIA® Instant Pike Place
0.5 cup  cucumber, peeled, seeded and grated

recipeInstructions.text: Dissolve half of your Starbucks VIA® Instant Pike Place packet with hot water in a pitcher.
Add lemonade, sugar, cucumber and mint to pitcher.
Let chill for several hours.
To serve, add ice to glasses and pour beverage over the top.

description: Refresh your day with Sparkling Espresso with Mint. This bubbly, effervescent drink is deliciously minty and features the delicious Starbucks® espresso taste you love.
name: Sparkling Espresso with Mint​

recipeInstructions.text: Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add simple syrup, fresh mint and Starbucks Brand espresso.
Shake vigorously for 10 seconds.
Strain into a glass filled with ice.
Top with sparkling water.

description: Your perfect fall nightcap. Create your own delicious salty caramel martini, featuring Starbucks® Salted Caramel Mocha Flavored Coffee.
name: Salted Caramel Coffee Martini
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Salted Caramel Mocha Flavored Coffee, brewed and cooled
Extra caramel sauce and sea salt flakes to rim glass

recipeInstructions.text: Place ice in a martini shaker​. Add the cooled Starbucks® Salted Caramel Mocha Flavored Coffee, coffee liqueur, vodka, caramel sauce, half-and-half, and a pinch of sea salt into the shaker.​
Place lid on and shake for 20 seconds. ​
Rim 2 martini glasses with caramel sauce and a sprinkle of sea salt flakes.
Divide mixture from the shaker into the glasses. Enjoy.​

description: Pumpkin spice on ice. With this Pumpkin Spice Cold Foam recipe, your fall days just got tastier.
name: Pumpkin Spice Cold Foam
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Pumpkin Spice Flavored Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Place water, sugars, pumpkin purée, vanilla extract and pumpkin pie spice into a sauté pan. ​
Simmer for 4 minutes until the sugars are melted.
Strain through fine mesh strainer into a container.
Store and keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.
After making the Sweet Pumpkin Spice Syrup, pour Starbucks® Cold Brew Pumpkin Spice Flavored Concentrate into a glass over ice, add water and stir.
Put the milk and Sweet Pumpkin Spice Syrup in an aeretor and froth using the cold foam setting. If using a handheld frother, pour ingredients into a separate container and froth until fluffy.
Gently pour on top of your iced coffee. Enjoy.
